default: (a) {@item chain mail|PHB} or (b) {@item leather armor|PHB}, a {@item longbow|PHB}, and {@item Arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows}
(a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|PHB} or (b) two {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item light crossbow|phb} and {@item Crossbow Bolts (20)|phb|20 bolts} or (b) two {@item handaxe|PHB|handaxes}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|PHB} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|PHB}

fluff.name: Warlord
entries: A woman in furs and scale mail directs her companions, her orders always one step ahead of the flow of battle. Her enemies are overwhelmed and her allies quickly dispatch the orc raiders.
A tanned dwarf strides up a dune and squares up to a fearsome ogre. Undaunted by its massive size, the dwarf strikes a telling blow to his foe. His allies are inspired by this show of bravado.
A green dragonborn springs across the battlefield. At every front they fight alongside their allies, driving them on to battle beyond their wounds.

These figures are warlords, warriors who strive not just to do battle but to master the battlefield. Whether through intellect or cunning or brawn these figures guide their allies to victory regardless of the odds.

entries.name: Creating a Warlord
entries: As you create your warlord, think about where they developed their combat prowess and why they pursued a path of leadership. Does their keen tactical mind crave a perfect victory or do they simply love that when they speak, others follow?

A warlord can come from many walks of life. Perhaps their acumen was developed by keen study of ancient battle or apprenticeship under grand generals. Or maybe they learned to be clever as a way to survive in cruel battle or on the mean streets of a grimy metropolis.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a warlord quickly by following these suggestions. First, make Strength or Dexterity your highest ability score, depending on whether you want to focus on melee weapons or on archery (and finesse weapons). Your next-highest score should be Intelligence, or Charisma if you plan to adopt the Conqueror command archetype. Second, choose the soldier background.

tools: any one type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} or any one {@item musical instrument|PHB} of your choice

default: (a) a {@item shortsword|phb} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Revised Monk Changes
entries: {@b What has changed?} The revised monk introduces a new feature called Techniques - option-based features similar to the warlock's Invocations. These techniques are intended to act as the customizable core of the class. Core features of the original monk have been translated into Techniques. Some techiniques come with new ki abilities or stances to give the monk more options in combat.
{@b Why?} The revised monk is intended to solve the 3 major issues I felt undermined the original monk's design.

items: The core feature list has no decision space to distinguish one monk from another monk of the same tradition.
After level 7 the monk features don't strongly cultivate the fantasy of the acrobatic unarmed and unarmoured warrior.
The monk's offensive toolkit finished at 6th level with Ki-Empowered Strikes. In combat their best option was almost always to use their Stunning Strike feature.

entries: This revised monk is designed to be fully compatable with all existing subclasses and certain techniques even expand on the ability space of previously printed traditions.

default: (a) two {@item shortsword|phb|shortswords} or (b) two {@filter simple melee weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon;melee weapon=sand}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
A {@item longbow|phb} and a {@item quiver|phb} of {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows}

fluff.name: Revised Ranger Changes
entries: {@b What has changed?} The revised ranger introduces a new feature called Talents - option-based features similar to the warlock's Invocations. These talents are intended to act as the customizable core of the class. Core features of the original ranger have been translated into Talents.

{@b Why?} The ranger has been commonly cited as the weakest class. I designed this ranger to give the player a lot more decision space for their ranger's progression. Combining core features from the original ranger into single talents and adding important spells as talent bonuses both increase the ranger's power and flexibility while retaining the core fantasy.

subclass.name: Oath of the Sagittal Wardens
subclassFeatures: Oath of the Sagittal Wardens|Paladin|PHB|Sagittal Wardens|HTotE|3

subclassFeatures: Eyes on the Back of your Head|Ranger|PHB|Shared Form|HTotE|11

subclassFeatures: Eyes on the Back of your Head|Ranger (Revised)|HTotE|Shared Form|HTotE|11

subclassFeatures: Conclave of the Shared Form|Ranger (Revised)|UATheRangerRevised|Shared Form|HTotE|3

classFeature.name: Technique
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you expand your understanding and gain access to new techniques, means to improve and master your mind and body.

You gain a technique of your choice. Your techniques are detailed on this page {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=HToTE:MT}. When you gain certain monk levels, you learn additional techniques, as shown in the Tecnhniques Known column of the Monk table.
Additionally when you gain a level in this class you can choose one of the techniques you know and replace it with another technique you could learn at that level.

classFeature.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
entries: Additionally at 5th level, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

classFeature.name: Perfect Self
entries: At 20th level you have perfected the self within and without. Your Dexterity and Wisdom scores increase by 4. Your maximum for those scores also increases by 4.

classFeature.name: Natural Explorer
entries: You are skilled in navigating the natural world which grants you the following benefits:

items: You ignore difficult terrain.
Swimming and climbing natural environments costs you no additional movement.

entries: In addition, you are capable at traversing the wilderness and leading a group through it. You gain the following benefits after traveling for a minute or longer:

items: Difficult terrain does not impede your group's travel.
You have advantage on checks to navigate through wilderness.
You can move stealthily at a normal pace even while traveling as part of a group
Even when you are engaged in another activity while traveling (such as foraging, navigating or tracking), you remain alert to danger.

entries: Every 10 minutes you spend tracking you can learn one of the following pieces of information from the tracks:

items: The number of creatures that left the tracks.
The sizes of the creatures that left the tracks.
How long ago the tracks were left.
The travel pace of the creatures.

classFeature.name: Ranger Talent
entries: In your travels you have augmented your abilities with unique talents to overcome challenges and adapt to your environment.

You gain a ranger talent of your choice. Your ranger talents are detailed on this page {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=HToTE:RT}. When you gain certain ranger levels, you learn additional talents, as shown in the Talents Known column of the Monk table.
Additionally when you gain a level in this class you can choose one of the talents you know and replace it with another talent you could learn at that level.

classFeature.name: Legendary Slayer
entries: At 20th level, you become an unparalleled hunter of your enemies. At the start of each of your turns in combat you may choose one of the following options.

entries.name: Foebreaker
entries: Choose a creature you can see. Until the end of your turn you cannot target other creatures with attacks of any kind. Each attack you make against the chosen creature until the end of your turn scores a critical hit if you hit with the attack.

entries.name: Cull the Swarm
entries: Whenever you reduce a creature to 0 hit points on your turn you can immediately make an additional weapon attack.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose a fighting style from the list of optional features. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.

entries.name: Archery
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

entries.name: Defense
entries: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

entries.name: Dueling
entries: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

entries.name: Great Weapon Fighting
entries: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.

entries.name: Protection
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. You must be wielding a shield.

entries.name: Two-Weapon Fighting
entries: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.

classFeature.name: Inciting Word
entries: Your innate understanding of the flow of battle allows you to say just the right thing at just the right time. As a bonus action you can speak an inciting word to another friendly creature within 60 feet who can hear you. That ally gains temporary hit points equal to half your warlord level (minimum 1) for 1 minute.

classFeature.name: Orders
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you can deliver orders to your allies in the heat of battle to give them the edge over their enemies.
Unless otherwise stated, a creature must be within 60 feet and be able to hear you to benefit from your orders.
Once you have given orders the number of times shown for your warlord level in the Orders column of the Warlord table, you must finish a short or long rest before you can give orders again.
Some of your orders require a creature to make a saving throw to resist the order's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
You can give the following orders when you gain this feature:

entries.name: Strike True!
entries: You order an ally to bring down your foes. As an action choose another friendly creature. That creature can spend its reaction to immediately take the {@action Attack} action. Their next attack gains a bonus to the attack and damage roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum +1).

entries.name: Brace!
entries: You order an ally to prepare for the counterattack. As a bonus action you can choose an ally. That ally gains the benefits of your Inciting Word feature and can use its reaction to take the Dodge action.

entries.name: Get into Position!
entries: You order your squad to move to the ideal position to engage. As a bonus action, choose up to a number of other friendly creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1). Each of those creatures can immediately move up to half their speed.

entries.name: To Arms!
entries: You call out to your allies that battle has come, preparing them for the fight ahead. As a reaction to being surprised, you and up to a number of other friendly creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier are no longer surprised and may reroll their initiative rolls. You can use this reaction even if you are surprised and would otherwise be unable to act.

classFeature.name: Command Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you choose the archetype that defines your style of command. Choose the Commander, the Conqueror or the Skirmisher, detailed at the end of the class description. Your choice grants you additional features at 6th, 7th, 10th, 15th and 18th levels.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Battle of Wits
entries: At 6th level, you gain proficiency with all {@item gaming set|phb|gaming sets}. For each minute you spend playing a game with another creature you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to one of the following characteristics of your choice:

items: Perception score
Insight score
One ability score of your choice, dependent on what game was played
Total class levels (if any)
Warlord class levels (if any)

entries: After 5 minutes of play you can make an opposed check of the DM's choice against the creature to learn the exact value of one of the characteristics listed.

classFeature.name: Command Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Command Archetype.

classFeature.name: Command Archetype Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Command Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Advanced Orders
entries: At 9th level your have mastered more complex orders. You gain access to the following advanced orders. Advanced orders behave like orders with the following exceptions:
Once you have given an advanced order you must finish a short or long rest before you can give that advanced order again.

Some advanced orders spend multiple uses of your amount of Orders per warlord level per the Warlord table. In those cases, the advanced orders will have the numbers of Orders used in brackets alongside the name of the order.

entries.name: Arcane Support! (2 uses)
entries: As an action you order a magic-wielding ally to bring their power to bear. Choose another friendly creature, that creature can choose to spend its reaction to cast a spell that normally has a casting time of one action and does not require concentration of 2nd level or lower. You can choose to increase the number of uses this order takes. If you do the maximum spell level allowed is instead equal to the number of uses spent.

entries.name: Bring them Down! (2 uses)
entries: As a bonus action, you highlight one foe who you believe is the greatest threat to your plan. Choose a hostile creature you can see. You and each friendly creature gain advantage on their attack rolls against that creature and a bonus to all damage rolls equal to your Intelligence modifier until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Fight through the Pain!
entries: You can give this advanced order as a reaction to a friendly creature being reduced to 0 hit points. That creature is reduced to 1 hit point instead and can immediately spend one Hit Die to regain hit points per the benefits of a short rest. They also gain additional hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1) and the benefits of your Inciting Word feature. You can choose to increase the number of uses this order takes. If you do the creature can spend an additional hit die for each two additional uses spent.

classFeature.name: Command Archetype Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Command Archetype.

classFeature.name: Adaptive Tactician
entries: At 11th level, you learn the following order:

entries.name: Adapt the Plan
entries: As a reaction after you or a friendly creature fails a saving throw you or that friendly creature can reroll the saving throw.
Additionally, you have adapted clever non-verbal cues and signals. Your allies no longer need to hear you to benefit from your orders.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Fight in Step
entries: At 13th level, after you give an order as an action you can make a weapon attack as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Masterful Orders
entries: At 14th level you have mastered orders. You gain access to the following master orders. Master orders behave like orders with the following exceptions:
Once you have given a master order you must finish a long rest before you can give that it again.

Some master orders spend multiple uses of your amount of Orders per warlord level per the Warlord table. In those cases, the master orders will have the numbers of Orders used in brackets alongside the name of the order.
You can give the following master orders when you gain this feature:

entries.name: Make them Bleed! (3 uses)
entries: As an action, you call out to your allies to end the battle. You and each friendly creature can immediately make a weapon attack. This attack deals bonus damage equal to your Intelligence modifier. Each creature that suffers damage from this order must make a Constitution saving throw against your order DC. If they fail they suffer additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier at the end of each of their turns. This effect lasts for 1 minute. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a successful save.

entries.name: Renew the Troops. (4 uses)
entries: As an action you inspire your allies with renewed vigor. Each friendly creature can spend its reaction to spend a number of Hit Die up to your Intelligence modifier to regain hit points per the benefits of a short rest. They also gain additional hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier and the benefits of your Inciting Word feature.

classFeature.name: Command Archetype Feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Command Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Driven to Succeed
entries: At 17th level you and other friendly creatures in range to benefit from your orders gain a bonus to initiative equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Additionally, whenever a creature gains the benefits of your Inciting Word feature it can also choose one of the following additional benefits:

items: Increase their movement by 10 feet until the end of their turn.
Perform the {@action Search} or {@action Use an Object} action.
Their next attack roll cannot have disadvantage imposed on it.

classFeature.name: Command Archetype Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature granted by your Command Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeature.name: Master of War
entries: At 20th level you become the master of warfare and tactics. Whenever you roll initiative and have no more uses of Orders left, you regain 6 uses.
Additionally, whenever you give an advanced or master order as an action you may immediately give a non-advanced, non-master order as part of that same action.

subclassFeature.name: Shield Bearer
entries: To be a shield bearer is to carry the symbol of your cause and a ward against foes at all times. Those who follow this path view their shield as a symbol of power and seek to incorporate it into their fighting style.
The shield bearer with their shield must learn to attend any part of the battle and carry themselves amongst both common folk and noble courts to embody their cause.

entries.caption: Heraldric Tradition
rows: {@b Personal.} Your symbols represent the values you seek to embody; the scales of justice, the ringing of coins, the power of a crown.
{@b Mortal.}  Your symbols tie to the shared heritage or culture of a mortal race such as the great walls of a city or the flag of a righteous king.
{@b Fey.} Your symbols invoke the power and beauty of the archfey, figures of fable and myth; strange beasts half glimpsed in twilight or folk of unnatural beauty.
{@b Monstrous.} Your symbols invoke the aspects of the monsters of your world; the dragon's flaming maw, a medusa's gaze or the many heads of a hydra.
{@b Planar.} Your symbols are those of the planes that surround the mortal world; hosts of angels in glowing bastions, cackling fiends upon a throne of skulls.
{@b Strange.} Your symbols are strange or drawn from esoteric means; random sprays of blood marring a bronze aegis, a mirrored constellation, a piece of every enemy you have slain.

subclassFeature.name: Heraldric Tradition
entries: The symbols depicted on a shield bearer's shield are not just powerful in their own right. Symbols, imagery and heraldry are all important mechanisms that tie a warrior to the wider world; representing their connections to other groups or beings in the world or representing a personal choice or strongly held conviction.

Consider deciding the tradition your character's heraldry represents - images or symbols that hold a special link to your character's background or convictions. Think about how this tradition might affect your character's actions.

subclassFeature.name: Shield Fighter
entries: {@i 3rd-level Shield Bearer feature}

Beginning at 3rd level, you treat shields as martial melee weapons that deal 1d6 bludgeoning damage and have the light and thrown (range 30/60) properties. You can don or doff a shield with no action required when you use it to attack.

subclassFeature.name: Aegean Technique
entries: {@i 3rd-level Shield Bearer feature}
Also at 3rd level you develop a technique that transforms your shield into a versatile weapon. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Canny Hurl
entries: You can make {@action shove} attacks with your shield when you throw it.

entries.name: Angled Toss
entries: When you throw your shield you can elect to have it ricochet (from a nearby object or the target) and travel up to 60 feet away from the target. If you return the shield to a space within your reach you can catch it as long as you are not incapacitated and have a hand free.

subclassFeature.name: Herald of Arms
entries: {@i 7th-level Shield Bearer feature}
At 7th level you gain proficiency with {@item painter's supplies|PHB}.

You can spend your light activity during a long rest to use painter's supplies to add heraldry to your shield. You can only maintain heraldry on one shield and a shield can only have one heraldic icon.
When you add heraldry to your shield choose one of the heraldic icons below for the heraldry to represent.

entries.name: Dreadful Power
entries: Your heraldry invokes terrifying might. You can brandish your shield at an opponent who can see you as an action. This action can replace one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack} action. They must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your (Charisma) Intimidation score or become {@condition frightened} until the end of your next turn.
As long as your shield bears this herald you have proficiency in Charisma (Intimidation) and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks to argue with noble courts.

entries.name: Inspiring Presence
entries: Your heraldry inspires wonder in those around you. As an action you brandish your shield and grant you or a friendly creature within 30 feet temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1). This action can replace one of your attacks when you take the {@action Attack} action. That creature also has advantage on saving throws to avoid becoming  {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} for 1 minute.
As long as your shield bears this herald you have proficiency in Charisma (Persuasion) and advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks to inspire others.

entries.name: Gracious Poise
entries: Your heraldry recalls graceful perfection. As long as you bear this icon {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} against you have disadvantage.
As long as your shield bears this herald you have proficiency in Wisdom (Insight) and advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to avoid a social faux pas.

subclassFeature.name: Aegean Mastery
entries: {@i 10th-level Shield Bearer feature}
At 10th level you become a master of your technique. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Hefty Toss
entries: Your shoves and thrown weapon attacks deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Carom Master
entries: When you make multiple thrown weapon attacks you can elect to have each additional attack after the first use the location of the previous target as the starting position for the throw. You can use this ability to strike targets outside your line of sight.

subclassFeature.name: Heraldic Expertise
entries: {@i 15th-level Shield Bearer feature}
At 15th level your insight into the role of heraldry and its symbolic power becomes clearer. You gain proficiency with {@item alchemist's supplies|PHB}.
Each of your heraldic icons gains the following additional features:

entries.name: Dreadful Power
entries: As an action you force each creature of your choice that can see you in a 30 foot cone to succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your (Charisma) Intimidation score or become frightened until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Inspiring Presence
entries: When you use this icon you can also elect to grant the target the benefits of the {@spell bless} spell for the following minute. You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Gracious Poise
entries: While you bear this icon your speed increases by 10 feet. As a reaction after a creature performs an {@action opportunity attack} against you can make a weapon attack targeting that creature. This attack deals additional damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum +1).

subclassFeature.name: Living Icon
entries: {@i 18th-level Shield Bearer feature}
At 18th level you become a living icon. You can change your heraldic icon as part of a short rest.
Each of your icons grants you new power. As an action, you can gain the benefits of each of the following spells once per day from your icon;

entries.name: Dreadful Power
entries: {@spell fly}

entries.name: Inspiring Presence
entries: {@spell beacon of hope}

entries.name: Gracious Poise
entries: {@spell freedom of movement}

Finally, you gain the service of a devoted warrior who wishes to study under you. Should you die, your warrior will replace you; abandoning every part of their old identity to be subsumed by your icon.

This effect is normally identical to a {@spell reincarnate} spell though it operates at your DM's discretion. After you have used this feature you cannot use it again for a number of days equal to 2d12 minus your Charisma modifier (minimum 2 days).

subclassFeature.name: Way of Hundred Hands
entries: An orc smirks, arms crossed across her chest as three  marbled hands dispatch a group of ghouls. A figure in a grey uniform gestures at a fleeing criminal. Two hands emerge from the shadows of the alley and pin the hapless snatchpurse.

These heroes are adherents to an esoteric order. Practitioners of the Way of Hundred Hands seek to emulate the fighting style of ancient many-armed giants who fought in times of myth. Like those titans, these monks wish to bring down obstacles with demonstrations of overwhelming force.

entries.caption: Spectral Armament
rows: {@b Solid.} Your arms adopt near tangible forms; marbled stone, shining metal or knotted wood..
{@b Diaphonous.} Your arms adopt sheer forms, embracing their spectral nature; twisting water or shaped air..
{@b Wild.} Your arms embrace the bestial nature of the forms you practice; tiger's claws, hawk's talons or scorpion mandibles.
{@b Strange.} Your arms embrace the esoteric; hissing cobra maws or fizzling hooks pulled from your own shadow.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Armament
entries: The appearance of the spectral hands summoned by your monk can represent their own views on their discipline or connect them to the monastery or teacher that guided them to this style.

Consider deciding the tradition your character's heraldry represents - images or symbols that hold a special link to your character's background or convictions. Think about how this tradition might affect your character's actions.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Hands
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of Hundred Hands feature}

Beginning at 3rd level you can channel ki to conjure spectral hands. You can have a number of hands conjured equal to your proficiency bonus. You can conjure 1 hand as a bonus action or any number as an action, spending 1 ki point for each hand conjured. Your spectral hands last until the beginning of your next short or long rest. They can be dismissed as part of any other action. If you fall unconscious all spectral hands are immediately dismissed. Your spectral hands are treated as unarmed strikes that deal force damage equal to your Martial Arts damage die + your Wisdom modifier.
While conjured, each spectral hand provides the following benefits:

items: Increases your carrying capacity by a number of pounds equal to your monk level.
Increases your Athletics skill by 1.
Adds an additional point of force damage to your unarmed strikes.

subclassFeature.name: Master's Flurry
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of Hundred Hands feature}
Beginning at 6th level, whenever you perform a Flurry of Blows you can make 1 additional attack with a spectral hand.
At 13th level, you can also expend any number of spectral hands after the first to make that many additional attacks with them.

subclassFeature.name: Daili's Strike
entries: {@i 1th-level Way of Hundred Hands feature}

At 11th level, you can use your spectral hands to throw your opponents off-balance. You can expend a spectral hand to make a {@action shove} attack that can target a creature up to a number of feet away equal to your proficiency bonus × 5. You may expend a second hand as part of this attack to additionally {@condition restrained|PHB|restrain} the target until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Endless Assault
entries: {@i 17th-level Way of Hundred Hands feature}

At 17th level as an action you can spend any number of ki points and spectral hands to make a number of spectral unarmed strikes equal to the amount of spent ki points and expended spectral hands. You can't use this ability again until after you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Hundred Hands
entries: An orc smirks, arms crossed across her chest as three  marbled hands dispatch a group of ghouls. A figure in a grey uniform gestures at a fleeing criminal. Two hands emerge from the shadows of the alley and pin the hapless snatchpurse.

These heroes are adherents to an esoteric order. Practitioners of the Way of Hundred Hands seek to emulate the fighting style of ancient many-armed giants who fought in times of myth. Like those titans, these monks wish to bring down obstacles with demonstrations of overwhelming force.

entries.caption: Spectral Armament
rows: {@b Solid.} Your arms adopt near tangible forms; marbled stone, shining metal or knotted wood..
{@b Diaphonous.} Your arms adopt sheer forms, embracing their spectral nature; twisting water or shaped air..
{@b Wild.} Your arms embrace the bestial nature of the forms you practice; tiger's claws, hawk's talons or scorpion mandibles.
{@b Strange.} Your arms embrace the esoteric; hissing cobra maws or fizzling hooks pulled from your own shadow.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Armament
entries: The appearance of the spectral hands summoned by your monk can represent their own views on their discipline or connect them to the monastery or teacher that guided them to this style.

Consider deciding the tradition your character's heraldry represents - images or symbols that hold a special link to your character's background or convictions. Think about how this tradition might affect your character's actions.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Hands
entries: {@i 3rd-level Way of Hundred Hands feature}

Beginning at 3rd level you can channel ki to conjure spectral hands. You can have a number of hands conjured equal to your proficiency bonus. You can conjure 1 hand as a bonus action or any number as an action, spending 1 ki point for each hand conjured. Your spectral hands last until the beginning of your next short or long rest. They can be dismissed as part of any other action. If you fall unconscious all spectral hands are immediately dismissed. Your spectral hands are treated as unarmed strikes that deal force damage equal to your Martial Arts damage die + your Wisdom modifier.
While conjured, each spectral hand provides the following benefits:

items: Increases your carrying capacity by a number of pounds equal to your monk level.
Increases your Athletics skill by 1.
Adds an additional point of force damage to your unarmed strikes.

subclassFeature.name: Master's Flurry
entries: {@i 6th-level Way of Hundred Hands feature}
Beginning at 6th level, whenever you perform a Flurry of Blows you can make 1 additional attack with a spectral hand.
At 13th level, you can also expend any number of spectral hands after the first to make that many additional attacks with them.

subclassFeature.name: Daili's Strike
entries: {@i 11th-level Way of Hundred Hands feature}

At 11th level, you can use your spectral hands to throw your opponents off-balance. You can expend a spectral hand to make a {@action shove} attack that can target a creature up to a number of feet away equal to your proficiency bonus × 5. You may expend a second hand as part of this attack to additionally {@condition restrained|PHB|restrain} the target until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Endless Assault
entries: {@i 17th-level Way of Hundred Hands feature}

At 17th level as an action you can spend any number of ki points and spectral hands to make a number of spectral unarmed strikes equal to the amount of spent ki points and expended spectral hands. You can't use this ability again until after you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Sagittal Wardens
entries: These astral knights are an order of elite warriors responsible for the borders between the Material Plane, the Astral Sea and the Far Planes.

entries.subclassFeature: Tenets of the Astral Knight|Paladin|PHB|Sagittal Wardens|HTotE|3

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Momentum Transfer
entries: As an bonus action, you impart a melee weapon you are holding with cosmic balance, using it as a fulcrum for your own power to destroy your foes. For the next minute your weapon deals additional force damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

After you hit a Large or smaller target with a melee attack with the empowered weapon you may transfer your momentum into the target with a blast of force. The target must succeed a Strength saving throw or they are pushed half as far as you moved this turn (minimum 10 feet). If the target collides with something it stops moving and both the target and the creature or object they collided with suffer 1d6 force damage or 2d6 if the target is Large.
You can end this effect on your turn as part of any other action. If you are no longer holding or carrying this weapon, or if you fall unconscious, this effect ends.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Titan's Palm
entries: You bring down the power of the stars, trapping your foes in prisons of gravity. As an action you present your holy symbol and plead for power from the stellar forces. Each creature of your choice in a 20 foot cone must make a Strength saving throw. Aberrations have disadvantage on this saving throw.
On a failed save each creature is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute or until they take damage. On a successful save their speed is halved for 1 minute or until they take damage.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Sagittal Wardens Spells

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Astral Knight
entries: The tenets of the astral knights are as follows:

entries.name: Banish the Void
entries: The void attempts to invade the other planes at every turn. Grant it no quarter.

entries.name: Keep the World Pure
entries: Seek out those corrupted by the void and its agents and annihilate them completely.

entries.name: Burn with Stellar Power
entries: The creatures of the void are timeless and powerful. You must rise to match them.

subclassFeature.name: Orbital Aura
entries: At 7th level, your movement speed increases by 10 feet. Friendly creatures gain the same benefit until the start of their next turn if they start their turn with 10 feet of you or the first time they pass within 10 feet of you or vice-versa.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Comet Rush
entries: Beginning at 15th level, whenever you or an ally currently benefiting from additional movement speed granted by your abilities moves more than 20 feet on their turn they can gain one of the following benefits until the start of their next turn:

items: They have the benefits of half cover.
Their next melee attack deals an additional 1d8 force damage.
The have advantage on the first attempt they make to {@action shove} a creature.

subclassFeature.name: Master of the Universe
entries: At 20th level, you can embrace the full power of the stars. As an action you become a gateway to the cosmic.
For the next minute, your skin turns black as night sky and the only lights are your two eyes, which become blinding stars.

When a creature that can see your eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of you, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw against your paladin spell save DC if you are not incapacitated and can see the creature.
If a creature fails their saving throw they are {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. They can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a successful saving throw.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see you until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at you in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
For the duration, when another friendly creature benefits from your Comet Rush feature they can choose 2 benefits instead of 1.
Additionally, while in this form you can cast {@spell crown of stars|xge} or {@spell etherealness} once per day.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Minutemen
entries: These temporal knights are a secretive order of paladins who swear a solemn oath to the sands of time.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Temporal Clone
entries: As an action, you summon your temporal ghost for a number of rounds equal to your proficiency bonus.

The clone shares your abilities and statistics. The clone acts on your turn and can move and perform an action. It cannot perform any bonus actions or cast any spells. Any damage that would be dealt to the clone is dealt to you instead.

When you dismiss the clone as part of any action or when this ability ends you gain all conditions and levels of exhaustion currently affecting the clone. You can also choose to immediately teleport to the space previous occupied by the clone.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Hourglass Prison
entries: As an action, you present your holy symbol and call upon the fates to slip a creature out of time. Choose a creature you can see within 30 feet. That creature makes a Charisma saving throw. A friendly creature can elect to willingly succeed or fail this saving throw.
If the creature fails their saving throw they placed in stasis for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated. While in stasis the creature disappears and exists outside the timestream.

A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save and reappearing in the same space they disappeared from or the closest safe space if that space is unavailable.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Temporal Knight
entries: The tenets of the temporal knights are as follows:

entries.name: Follow the Fates
entries: The sands have their designs for the world. Strive for this natural order.

entries.name: Abide the Stream.
entries: The fates are neither kind nor cruel. They move the world and we are their gracious servants.

entries.name: Punish the Abhorrent
entries: Those who seek to distort time for their ends or avoid their fate through eldritch power must be destroyed so that time may flow.

subclassFeature.name: Precogniscent Aura
entries: At 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet gain a bonus to initiative rolls equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum +1).
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Harness the Fates
entries: Beginning at 15th level, you can use your reaction to grant yourself or a friendly creature within your Precogniscent Aura the option to reroll one die. You must keep the result of the second roll. This reroll must be used before the result of the roll is declared.

subclassFeature.name: The World outside of Time
entries: At 20th level you can step completely outside the timestream. Once per day you can cast the {@spell time stop} spell.

While you are under the effects of this spell you can create a temporal afterimage as an action. The temporal afterimage appears in your space. After the spell's duration ends each temporal afterimage immediately performs one action. The afterimages share your abilities and statistics. All afterimages disappear immediately after performing their actions.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Form
entries: The Shared Form rangers are defined by their choice to allow their bodies to house a second lifeform for mutual benefit. This symbiotic entity is integrated into their body, granting them a host of powerful natural abilities in return for protection and sustenance.

entries.caption: Symbiote Quirk
rows: Your symbiotic entity has been borne by previous hosts. You occassionally glimpse their memories through the entity.
Your symbiotic entity is a symbol of pride among your people. You overcame a great trial to earn your prize.
You cultivated a personal relationship with your entity before becoming its host. It still speaks to you as a second voice in your head.
Your entity was summoned through mystic means from an unknown plane of reality.
Your entity has a voracious hunger. You have to eat a great deal to keep both you and it full and satisfied.
After you began hosting your entity your gained a sudden talent with an instrument or form of artistic expression. Your compositions tend to be melancholic and strange.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiote Quirk
entries: The symbiotic entity your character bonds with can provide a number avenues to explore your character. The entity can tie into your character's background, culture and their relationship with other characters. The entity could be a character its own right, either through its relationship with your character or through their reputation.
Consider determining a quirk of your character's symbiote. Think about how this quirk might affect their actions.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Form Spells
entries: {@i 3rd-level Shared Form feature}

Starting at 3rd level, you learn an additional spell when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Shared Form Spells table. The spell counts as a ranger spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of ranger spells you know.

subclassFeature.name: Symbiosis
entries: {@i 3rd-level Shared Form feature}
At 3rd level the symbiotic entity begins to strengthen your body by cultivating powerful claws and talons at the end of your arms and legs.
You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes that deal 1d6 + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier slashing damage.
As long as you aren't wearing boots you can use your talons to make unarmed strikes that deal 1d8 + Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier piercing damage.

Your talons can also grasp things to improve your footing and perform simple tasks. They can't wield weapons or shields or do anything that requires manual precision, such as using tools or magic items or performing the somatic components of a spell.

subclassFeature.name: Instinctive Body
entries: {@i 3rd-level Shared Form feature}
At 3rd level after making a weapon attack on your turn you can make an unarmed strike as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Survival of the Fittest
entries: {@i 7th-level Shared Form feature}

At 7th level your symbiotic entity enhances your body to make you a more capable survivor. Your hit point maximum increases by 7 and increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class. At the start of each day your symbiote can grant you one of the following bonuses:

entries.name: Hot-Blooded
entries: You have resistance to cold damage and can tolerate temperatures as low as -50 degrees Fahrenheit without any additional protection.

entries.name: Robust Humors
entries: You have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws to resist diseases and poisons.

entries.name: Insulated Musculature.
entries: You have resistance to fire damage and can tolerate temperatures as high as 110 degrees Fahrenheit without any additional protection.

As a reaction to taking damage you can launch quills at a creature within your reach. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take piercing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier or Dexterity modifier. You cannot use this reaction if you are wearing heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Second Opinion
entries: {@i 7th-level Shared Form Archetype feature}
At 7th level as a reaction after rolling a Wisdom check you can roll again but you must use the second result. This decision is made after rolling the die but before learning the result of the check.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Claws
entries: {@i 7th-level Shared Form feature}

Additionally at 7th level your natural attacks count as magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistance. Once on each of your turns when you miss with a melee attack, you can make an unarmed strike as part of the same action.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes on the Back of your Head
entries: {@i 11th-level Shared Form feature}

At 11th level your symbiote can help you react quickly to avoid danger. When you fail a Dexterity or Wisdom saving throw against an effect you are aware of you can reroll the saving throw but you must use the second result. You cannot use this feature again without spending a spell slot of 1st level or higher or finishing a short or long rest. You cannot use this feature if you are blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

subclassFeature.name: Living Armor
entries: {@i 15th-level Shared Form feature}

At 15th level your symbiote completely integrates with your body. It cultivates hardy subdermal armor that can absorb harm. As a bonus action you can subsume yourself into your symbiotic armor and gain resistance to bludgeoning, slashing and piercing damage for 1 minute. As a reaction to taking damage while within your symbiote armor you can expend the armor to gain resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn. You cannot use this feature again unless you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher or until you finish a short or long rest.

As a reaction to taking damage while within your symbiote armor you can expend the armor to gain resistance to all damage until the start of your next turn. You cannot use this feature again unless you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher or until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Commander
entries: The Commander is the ideal tactical leader. They master the art of reading and eventually predicting the battlefield. Their mixture of responsive orders and cunning gambits combined with their mastery of heavy armor makes them a bastion of leadership.

subclassFeature.name: Hard to Crack
entries: {@i 3rd-level Commander feature}
Beginning at 3rd level when you take this archetype you gain proficiency in heavy armor.

subclassFeature.name: Implacable Command
entries: {@i 3rd-level Commander feature}
Additionally at 3rd level whenever you give an order, advanced order or master order, you can treat your Intelligence modifier as double its normal value (to a maximum of +5 total).
You also learn the following order:

entries.name: Gambit
entries: As a bonus action choose a hostile creature you can see. You make one of the following predictions:

items: The creature will make a weapon attack against a specific target.
The creature will cast a spell on a specific target.
The creature will move so that it is closer to a specific target.
The creature will move so that it is further away from a specific target.

entries: When you make the prediction you choose another creature or object of interest as the specific target. If the target creature fulfills your prediction at any stage before the end of your next turn you can use your reaction to immediately give a non-advanced, non-master order.

subclassFeature.name: Inspirational Incitement
entries: {@i 6th-level Commander feature}
At 6th level, when a creature gains the benefits of your Inciting Word feature it gains additional temporary hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Instrument of War
entries: {@i 7th-level Commander feature}
At 7th level, you gain proficiency in the {@item drum|phb} and the {@item horn|phb}. You can use a musical instrument you are proficient with to double the range of your orders.

subclassFeature.name: Reactionary Tactician
entries: {@i 10th-level Commander feature}
At 10th level you learn the following advanced order:

entries.name: Precogniscant Scheme
entries: As a reaction you can immediately give any order.

subclassFeature.name: Battlemind
entries: {@i 15th-level Commander feature}
Beginning at 15th level you gain the following master order:

entries.name: Masterstroke
entries: As a action you can immediately perform 2 non-master orders.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Command
entries: {@i 18th-level Commander feature}
At 18th level, whenever you give an order you or one friendly creature that benefits from the order of your choice gains the benefits of your Inciting Word feature.

subclassFeature.name: Conqueror
entries: The Conqueror is a leader who drives their gang foremost with the strength of their personality. Their innate tactical acumen underlies their brash commands and self-important manner. The Conqueror leads from the front so that when they achieve victory, all will know their name.

subclassFeature.name: Bravado
entries: {@i 3rd-level Conqueror feature}
Beginning at 3rd level when you take this archetype, you can substitute your Intelligence modifier with your Charisma modifier when you use any of your warlord features.

subclassFeature.name: Lead from the Front
entries: {@i 3rd-level Conqueror feature}
Additionally at 3rd level, when you use your {@b Get into Position!} order you may move up to half your speed.
You also learn the following order:

entries.name: Watch this Folks!
entries: As an action you lead your allies by example. You make an weapon attack with a bonus to your attack roll equal to your Intelligence modifier. If you hit, each friendly creature gains the benefit of your Inciting Word feature.

subclassFeature.name: Incite to Violence
entries: {@i 6th-level Conqueror feature}

At 6th level, when a creature gains the benefits of your Inciting Word feature, it can choose as part of its next weapon attack to spend any number of temporary hit points. That attack deals additional damage equal to the temporary hit points spent.

subclassFeature.name: Powerful Voice
entries: {@i 7th-level Conqueror feature}

At 7th level, you gain proficiency with the Intimidation skill or if you are already proficient in Intimidation you double your proficiency bonus. Additionally the range of your orders increases by your Charisma score.

subclassFeature.name: Braggadocious Leader
entries: {@i 10th-level Conqueror feature}
Beginning at 10th level you gain the following advanced order:

entries.name: Thank you Sir May I have Another
entries: As a reaction after taking damage, you can shrug off your opponent's blow to inspire your allies. You and each other friendly creature gains the benefits of your Inciting Word feature.
The attacking creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against your order DC. If they fail they have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of their next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Frontman's Gamble
entries: {@i 15th-level Conqueror feature}
At 15th level you gain the following master order:

entries.name: Callout Gambit
entries: As a bonus action, choose a hostile creature with 2 or more Intelligence that can hear you. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. A creature has disadvantage on this check if you have attacked it within the last round.
If the creature fails it has advantage on attack rolls against you for the next minute and other friendly creatures have advantage on attack rolls against the hostile creature for the same minute.

Whenever the hostile creature deals damage to you another friendly creature within a number of feet equal to your Charisma score of you or the hostile creature can use its reaction to immediately make a weapon attack against the hostile creature.

subclassFeature.name: People's Champion
entries: {@i 18th-level Conqueror feature}
At 18th level, after an ally gains the benefit of any of your orders they have advantage on the next attack roll or saving throw they make.

subclassFeature.name: Skirmisher
entries: The Skirmisher is a leader who favors adopting a flexible approach to the battlefield. They espouse the values of engaging the enemy at a distance and controlling the battlefield with keen positioning and use of terrain. The Skirmisher leads by example, moving easily over wilderness and ordering well-timed ranged barrages.

subclassFeature.name: Guerrilla
entries: {@i 3rd-level Skirmisher feature}
Beginning at 3rd level when you select this archetype you gain proficiency in the Stealth skill.

subclassFeature.name: Skirmish Tactics
entries: {@i 3rd-level Skirmisher feature}
Additionally at 3rd level the first time you give an order each turn your movement speed increases by your Intelligence score until the end of your turn.
You also gain the following order:

entries.name: Hit and Fade
entries: As an action choose another friendly creature. That creature can spend its reaction to immediately perform two of the three options listed below:

items: Make a weapon attack.
Move up to half their speed.
Take the {@action Hide} action.

subclassFeature.name: Mobile Incitement
entries: {@i 6th-level Skirmisher feature}
At 6th level whenever a creature gains the benefits of your Inciting Word feature it can move up to half its speed.

subclassFeature.name: Seeker's Cunning
entries: {@i 7th-level Skirmisher feature}
At 7th level, you gain proficiency in the Survival skill or the Nature skill. When you are traveling overland your group can move at normal travel pace and still make Stealth checks.

subclassFeature.name: Rain of Thorns
entries: {@i 10th-level Skirmisher feature}
At 10th level you gain the following advanced order:

entries.name: Volley! (2 uses)
entries: As an action, choose a number of creatures equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 2). Each of those creatures can use their reaction to immediately make a ranged weapon attack.
You can choose to increase the number of uses this order takes. If you do for each additional use spent choose another creature to benefit from this order.

subclassFeature.name: Overwhelming Barrage
entries: {@i 15th-level Skirmisher feature}
At 15th level you gain the following master order:

entries.name: Fill the Sky! (3 uses)
entries: As an action, you and each friendly creature can make 2 ranged weapon attacks or cast a cantrip that makes a ranged spell attack. Each creature hit by an attack from this order must make a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Skirmish Leader
entries: {@i 15th-level Skirmisher feature}
At 18th level the first time each turn you make a weapon attack you can perform an Inciting Word without requiring an action.

optionalfeature.name: Arm Shelters Heart
entries: You move like the crane, using your wings to to divert and avoid blows. You can use your reaction to deflect or halt a weapon when you are hit by a melee weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.
If you reduce the damage to 0 you can make an unarmed strike against the creature that made the attack as part of the same action.

entries.name: Crane Kick
entries: As a reaction to a creature missing you with an attack you can spend 1 ki point to make an unarmed strike. If the attack hits that creature must also make a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Body Shelters Soul
entries: During your turn you have resistance to all damage except psychic and force damage.

entries.name: Spinning Leopard Manuever
entries: As an action you can spend 2 ki points to you move up your speed. The first time a creature is within your reach during this movement you can make an unarmed strike against them. Whenever a creature hits you with an {@action opportunity attack} during this movement you can choose one of the following:

items: Increase your movement speed by 5 feet until the end of your turn.
Make an unarmed strike against that creature.

optionalfeature.name: Eye Divines Truth
entries: Using intense focus you can open your third eye. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell detect magic}.
Additionally as a bonus action you can spend 2 ki points to gain {@sense blindsight} out to a range of 60 feet for 1 minute.
Beginning at 13th level you can spend 4 ki points to gain {@sense truesight} out to a range of 60 feet for 1 minute.

optionalfeature.name: Fist Shatters Earth
entries: You can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Falling Stone Stance
entries: At the start of your turn you may enter the stance of Falling Stone. Until the start of your next turn when you deal damage to an object or construct or knock a creature {@condition prone} you deal an additional 1d8 bludgeoning damage. You cannot enter more than one stance at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Foot Kisses Wind
entries: You tread with purpose towards enlightenment. Your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. This bonus increases when you reach certain monk levels, as shown in the table below.
Additionally, you can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level.
Beginning at 7th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

entries.name: As the Arrow Flies
entries: As an bonus action you can spend 2 ki points to fly up to your speed and make an unarmed strike. You fall normally at the end of your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Ki Emboldens Body
entries: Your mastery of the ki flowing through you makes you immune to disease and poison.
Additionally your ki sustains you so that you suffer none of the frailty of old age, you can't be aged magically and you no longer need food or water.

entries.name: Snake Swallows Venom
entries: As a reaction when you would suffer poison damage or make a saving throw against an effect that would deal poison damage or infect you with a disease you may safely store the affliction in your body. You may release the affliction as part of any other damaging ability to deal additional poison damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your monk level. You can store one affliction within your body.

optionalfeature.name: Maw Scours Flesh
entries: Your bared teeth and powerful claws evoke the form of the powerful tiger. Your unarmed strikes can deal slashing damage.

Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing unarmed strike or monk weapon, the target must make a Constitution saving throw against your ki save DC or take additional damage equal to half your monk level.

entries.name: Tiger Stance
entries: At the start of your turn you may enter the stance of the Tiger. Until the start of your next turn your unarmed strikes score a critical hit on a 19 or a 20. You cannot enter more than one stance at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Mouth Captures Life
entries: Through inhalation you focus the mind, through exhalation you greet the world. You can use a bonus action to end one effect on yourself that is causing you to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.
Additionally you learn to touch the ki of other minds so that you understand all spoken languages. Moreover, any creature that can understand a language can understand what you say.

entries.name: Exulting Word
entries: As an action you may spend 3 ki points to speak a word that exults your place in the world. Each hostile creature of your choice within 15 feet that can hear you must make a Constitution saving throw or suffer 2d8 + your Wisdom modifier thunder damage. Each friendly creature of your choice within the same area gains half that amount of temporary hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Open the Gates of Battle
entries: When you roll for initiative and have no ki points remaining, you regain a number of ki points equal to your proficiency bonus. If you have ki points remaining you instead have advantage on the initiative roll.

optionalfeature.name: Palm Catches Rain
entries: You have the grace and speed to pick raindrops from the air. You can use your reaction to deflect or catch a missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile if it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free. If you catch a missile in this way, you can spend 1 ki point to make a ranged attack with the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction. You make this attack with proficiency, regardless of your weapon proficiencies, and the missile counts as a monk weapon for the attack, which has a normal range of 20 feet and a long range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Raincatcher Stance
entries: At the start of your turn you may enter the stance of the Raincatcher. Until the start of your next turn you may also use your reaction to deflect ranged weapon attacks against friendly creatures within reach. You cannot enter more than one stance at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Palm Snares Flame

prerequisite.other: {@class monk|phb|Way of Four Elements|Four Elements|phb|2-1}, {@optfeature Palm Catches Rain|HTotE}

entries: You can spend 1 ki point to cast the {@spell shield} or {@spell absorb elements|xge} spells.
You can use the reaction granted by your Palm Catches Rain feature to deflect ranged spell attacks.
Additionally whenever you prevent damage from the {@spell magic missile} spell using the {@spell shield} spell you may redirect one dart towards a new target of your choice.

entries.name: Flower Swallows Sun
entries: When you use the reaction granted by your Palm Catches Rain feature and the damage reduced includes any fire, cold, lightning or thunder damage you may regain 1 ki point. You can use this feature once and cannot use it again until after you have finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Soul Stands Unbroken
entries: Your mastery of ki grants you proficiency in all saving throws. Additionally, whenever you make a saving throw and fail, you can spend 1 ki point to reroll it and take the second result.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Pierces Heart
entries: You may spend 2 ki point to cast {@spell shadow blade|xge}.

entries.name: Preying Shade Stance
entries: At the start of your turn you can enter the stance of the Preying Shade. Until the start of your next turn when you deal damage to a creature and you had advantage on the attack roll you deal additional psychic damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier. You cannot enter more than one stance at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Swallows Form
entries: You may spend 4 ki points to cast {@spell shadow of moil|xge} without requiring material components.
Whenever you cast a spell granted by your Shadow Arts feature you can spend 1 additional ki point to cast that spell for its maximum duration without requiring concentration.

optionalfeature.name: Skill Refines Truth
entries: Through the pratice of expressive form, you determine a truth that underpins symbols and writing. You gain proficiency with calligraphers tools.
You can attempt to cast any spell scroll with a spell level lower than your proficiency bonus as though it was a spell of your class using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Guides Form
entries: You have allowed your spirit to flow freely into your spectral hands to echo your resolve.
As a reaction when you take damage you can expend a spectral hand to gain a number of temporary hit points equal to the damage roll of the hand.

entries.name: Guarded Spirit Stance
entries: At the start of your turn you can enter the stance of the Guarded Spirit. Until the start of your next turn whenever you lose temporary hit points you can make one unarmed strike. You cannot enter more than one stance at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Storm Drowns Sky
entries: You have studied the storm and learned the following elemental disciplines:

entries.name: {@optfeature Whirlwind Kick|HTotE}
entries: As an action, you can spend 2 ki points and choose a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Winds howl in a 20 foot radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature in the sphere must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take 1d8 bludgeoning damage and be moved to an unoccupied space of your choice in the sphere.

entries.name: {@optfeature Storm Heeds the Will|HTotE|Storm Heeds the Will (13th Level Required)}
entries: You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell storm sphere|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: World Embraces One
entries: You can use your action to spend 4 ki points to become invisible for 1 minute. During that time, you also have resistance to all damage but force damage.
Additionally, you can spend 8 ki points to cast {@spell astral projection} without needing material components. When you do so, you can't take any other creatures with you.

optionalfeature.name: Whirlwind Kick
entries: As an action, you can spend 2 ki points and choose a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Winds howl in a 20 foot radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature in the sphere must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take 1d8 bludgeoning damage and be moved to an unoccupied space of your choice in the sphere.

optionalfeature.name: Storm Heeds the Will
entries: You can spend 5 ki points to cast {@spell storm sphere|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Adaptable Hunter
entries: You have learned to adapt your strategies to combat different foes. When you finish a long rest you can choose a different option for your {@subclassFeature Hunter's Prey|Ranger||Hunter||3}, {@subclassFeature Defensive Tactics|Ranger||Hunter||7}, {@subclassFeature Multiattack|Ranger||Hunter||11} and {@subclassFeature Superior Hunter's Defense|Ranger||Hunter||15}  class features.

optionalfeature.name: Ambush Tactics
entries: You are skilled at the art of camouflage and quickly vanishing from sight. You can {@action Hide} as a bonus action.
You can spend 1 minute assembling camouflage for a creature or campsite. Creatures have disadvantage on checks to locate a camouflaged campsite if they are not already familiar with it.
A camouflaged creature has advantage on checks to avoid detection until it moves more than 50 feet, makes an attack or casts a spell with a somatic component.
Beginning at 2nd level you learn {@spell pass without trace}. The spell doesn't count against your number of ranger spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Favored Enemy
entries: You have experience in battling a certain kind of enemy. Choose a type of creature. You gain a +2 bonus to weapon damage rolls against creatures of the chosen type. You have advantage on checks to track or recall information about your favored enemy. You learn a language of your choice.
When you finish a long rest you can change your favored enemy options.
Beginning at 2nd level you learn {@spell hunter's mark}. The spell doesn't count against your number of ranger spells known.
Beginning at 6th level your bonus damage increases to +4. In addition you have advantage on saving throws against the spells and abilities of your favored enemy.

optionalfeature.name: Favored Terrain
entries: You are experienced with traversing a certain environment. Choose an environment: arctic, coastal, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, swamp and underground/Underdark.
You gain the following benefits while traversing through your favored terrain:

items: You can't be surprised.
When you forage you gather twice as many supplies as normal.

When you forage you can also assemble one of the following items from improvised material: {@item caltrops (bag of 20)|phb|a bag of caltrops}, a {@item bedroll|phb}, {@item hempen rope (50 feet)|phb|50 feet of rope}, a {@item hunting trap|phb}, a {@item javelin|phb} or a {@item shield|phb}. You can assemble a number of items while foraging equal to your Wisdom modifier each day.

entries: At the end of a long rest after traveling through a terrain that differs from your favored terrain you can change your favored terrain to reflect the terrain you are traversing.

Beginning at 2nd level you learn {@spell feather fall} and beginning at 5th level you learn {@spell spider climb}. You treat these as ranger spells and they don't count against your number of ranger spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Feral Senses
entries: You have preternatural senses that help you pursue your foes and avoid being deceived. You are aware of the location of any unseen creature within 30 feet of you as long as you aren't {@condition blinded} or {@condition deafened}. You have advantage on checks and saving throws to disbelieve illusions.
You do not suffer disadvantage for attacking a creature you can't see or who is using an illusion spell or ability to impose disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Foe Slayer
entries: You are an unparalleled hunter. Once per turn you can add your Wisdom modifier to an attack or damage roll. You can choose to use this feature before or after the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Hedge Mage
entries: You have some practise with the formalised study of magic. You can use an {@item arcane focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your spells.

For each level of ranger spell you can cast, you learn a wizard spell of 1st level. The first time you learn a ranger spell of a new level, you learn a wizard spell of 1st level. You treat these as ranger spells and they don't count against your number of ranger spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Lead the Pack
entries: You are a fearsome and powerful leader who exudes a deadly aura. When you hit a creature they must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn. A creature can only be {@condition frightened} by this ability once every 24 hours. Friendly creatures have advantage on attack rolls against creatures that are {@condition frightened} of you.

optionalfeature.name: Old Faith Lore
entries: You have studied the ways of the druids to grow closer to nature. You learn the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip.

For each level of ranger spell you can cast, you learn a druid spell of the same level. The first time you learn a ranger spell of a new level, you learn a druid spell of the same level. You treat these as ranger spells and they don't count against your number of ranger spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Primal Steed
entries: You can channel druidic magic to transmute your beast into a companion suitable to ride into battle. Once per day as an action you can cast {@spell find steed} by dismissing beast companion as an additional spell component. You can dismiss your steed as an action to restore it's beastial form. If you gain a new animal companion while your steed is summoned it is immediately dismissed.
Beginning at 13th level you can instead cast {@spell find greater steed|xge} with this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Primeval Awareness
entries: Your senses sharpen allowing you to react quickly or expand your perception to see beyond your surroundings.
You have advantage on initiative checks.
You can spend a spell slot or 1 minute to attune to your surroundings and sense the following:

items: Any favored enemies in the surrounding mile.
Any powerful aberrations, celestial, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends or undead in the surrounding mile.

entries: If there are multiple groups you learn the number of groups present. You then learn one of the following for the first minute and each additional minute spent concentrating:

items: The approximate distance and direction of each group.
The approximate distance, direction and strength of one group.

entries: At the DM's discretion you can learn additional information such as the activity or intent of a group and whether the group provokes an impression from the wilderness (native fey or elves might provoke a positive impression, aberrant creatures or hags might provoke a negative impression).
The DM may also allow you to detect lairs or regions affected by powerful creatures with this ability.
Beginning at 5th level you learn {@spell locate object} and beginning at 13th level you learn {@spell locate creature}. These spells don't count against your number of ranger spells known.

optionalfeature.name: Strider
entries: You are accustomed to traversing the wilds at a swift pace. You can {@action Dash} as a bonus action.
You take no damage from nonmagical dangerous terrain and have advantage on saving throws to avoid becoming slowed or restrained.

optionalfeature.name: Survival Instincts
entries: Your mind is sharp and canny. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Tap the Leylines

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Favored Terrain|HTotE} or {@optfeature Old Faith Lore|HTotE}

entries: You can tap into the power of the land to perform feats beyond your own capabilities. Once per day you may cast a 9th or lower level druid spell that does not require material components of your choice.
In addition you qualify as a druid for any magic item requirements and can use an {@item druidic focus|phb} as a spellcasting focus for your spells.

optionalfeature.name: Traveler's Orison
entries: Your daily prayers grant you minor boons. You learn the {@spell thaumaturgy} cantrip.

You learn a cleric spell of a level for which you have ranger spell slots. You treat it as ranger spell and they don't count against your number of ranger spells known. At the end of each long rest you can choose to learn a different cleric spell.

optionalfeature.name: Wanderer's Arcana
entries: You weave your magic in unusual ways to reduce the strain on your mind. You can cast a 1st level ranger spell that requires concentration without expending a spell slot and without requiring concentration a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. You cannot have more that one spell in effect with this ability at the same time.

optionalfeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Warrior of the Wilds
entries: You are a versatile combatant who can utilize a variety of weapons. You can choose a second option from the Fighting Style feature.

optionalfeature.name: Wardweaver
entries: You can bend your magic into wards. As a reaction after making a saving throw you can reroll and keep the result of the second roll. This reroll must be used before the result of the roll is declared.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a long rest or expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Witchguard
entries: You have studied arcane lore to improve and expand your spellcasting potential. You learn a sorcerer spell of 3rd level of lower. You treat it as ranger spell and it don't count against your number of ranger spells known.
Once per day after you finish a short rest you can regain a spell slot of 3rd level or lower.
